question: when was the canadian pacific railway started and finished
api_result: The Canadian Pacific Railway (CPR) was started with the incorporation of the company on February 16, 1881. The construction of the railway itself began later that year. The project was completed when the last spike was driven on November 7, 1885, at Craigellachie, British Columbia. This monumental event marked the completion of the railway's transcontinental main line, connecting Montreal, Quebec, to Vancouver, British Columbia.
